page.title: 09BEEF FARMING, DERVOCK.
page.content: In our block there are nine farms involved with beef cattle, none of which depends solely on beef farming for income. The farmers all own their farms which average about 75 acres. In the summer months most of the farmers make silage and hay which are used for winter feeding, along with concentrates and barley. On average each farm has eighty cattle and the main breed would be{Friesian.}Some of the cattle are bought and sold at {Ballymoney Market,}others are sent to {Abbey Meats, Whiteabbey, Foyle Meats, {Londonderry,}or some other meat plant to be killed and packed. Some farmers rear their own cattle from calves, others buy store cattle. The farmer must look after his cattle well to ensure that they will thrive and increase in weight and therefore produce a good quality meat.
